content.description: The arete of Bury the Hatchet has an obvious direct start. It goes from some obvious decent holds to a terrible sloper and then somehow into the holds that mark the start of crux for Bury the Hatchet.Â The stud for this project needs a bolt hanger added to it, anyone is free to give it a try.
content.location: Locate Bury the Hatchet, and start the arete directly via a hard boulder problem

content.description: An excellent "bolter problem" up a steep arete. From the belay stick clip and scamper up a slab to reach a left trending line of crimps that take you to the arete. Do a powerful and tricky crux sequence and clip the last bolt, then keep it together through jugs on your way to the top. When you get to the anchor find a comfy rest position to clip, then finish off by mantling over the lip. It ain't over til it's over.
content.protection: 3 bolts. 4 bolts if the direct start gets sent.
content.location: This is the first obvious climb when approaching the Waternomee crags, to the right is a 5.8 corner.

content.description: The first small crag you come upon on the path up to Waternomee is Mininomee, home to 3 climbs 5.5 to 5.10c. Just to the left is the even smaller crag "Micronomee Buttress" with 2 climbs (presently). Jon indicates that, while small (30 ft) these climbs [ 5.10d/5.11a and 5.10c] have "attitude"!
